Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: damos27
Reviews.Content: The young lady behind the counter is highly service oriented. When asked for things to do in the area, she had several ideas and even gave written instuctions on how to get there. Her communication skills are strong. And her pleasant personality helped to make my stay comfortable and I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, a bit run down in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: J E
Reviews.Content: We stay at Hampton Inns often, in fact, I am typing this from another one in Kingsman, AZ, so don't expect super luxury, however, the rooms were pretty cramped, carpet a bit worn and the bathrooms were tiny. Also, no real closet, just a little cupboard type thing. On the plus side, the pool was nice, although you had to go through the lobby outside and walk down a sidewalk to get to and from it. The breakfast was the worst in my HI experience; the eggs were tasteless and a very odd consistency like little pebbles, no bacon or sausage like most HI breakfasts have. The location is really pretty and close to some nice shopping, as well as really convenient right off the interstate. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, but the owner needs to spend some money getting the rooms in this property up to the standard of the other 30 or so HI's we've stayed in over the last few years. I'd probably give it a B minus or C plus.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location north of Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Nebtravler
Reviews.Content: Traveling through and wanted to get on the north side of Phoenix before we stopped. This location was perfect for us and the hotel is newer with unique room decor that reflects the desert/western area. Clean room and comfortable beds. Easy on and off interstate. Everything I expect from an Hampton!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service - Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Laura T
Reviews.Content: My son had a baseball tournament in Anthem, AZ. We wanted to stay close to the field. Anthem is a suburb about 15 to 20 minutes north of Phoenix. The big landmark there is an outlet mall that could use a lot more business, frankly. The Hampton Inn in Anthem offered a great rate and received high ratings from other travelers so I booked. When we arrived, it was past midnight. I guess Hampton cancels reservations for guests who don't arrive by midnight. They had just cancelled us but promptly gave us a room when we arrived. Unfortunately, the desk manager didn't look at the rate I was supposed to get ($9 per night lower than he put in for us)...but that got straightened out at check-out and Hampton honored the lower rate no problem. The hotel is very clean and well kept. The rooms are spacious and quiet. I am very picky about bed firmness and the bed was pretty good. Linens were in good shape. Towels were still nice and thick. The bathrooms are kind of tight...not much space in there. But the tub was clean and they launder their shower curtains. Counter tops were in good shape and they provided us with ample towels. Complimentary breakfast was nice...they offer a good selection but if you like bacon or sausage with your eggs, you'll want to go to the Denny's across the parking lot. The hotel features a hot breakfast (eggs & potatoes or biscuits & gravy), oatmeal, dry cereal, pastries, fresh fruit, and waffles (that you make yourself). There were enough spaces to sit and there is a sitting room in the lobby too. I used the business center and that was in good shape too, enough to print out boarding passes in a hurry. There is a pool outside. My husband watched the hotel maintenance man clean the pool from our room window and was impressed with how hard that man worked. He really put in a lot of physical effort to clean that pool, not just a quick, get-it-over-with task. We are impressed with how conscientious people are doing their jobs. Everyone at this hotel seemed to really be invested in their jobs and it shows in how well run the hotel is. The best service story here was what happened on our last night of our 3 night stay. The guests in the room next to us decided to burn incense in their room. The odor was awful and made me physically ill. I called the front desk around 10PM. They contacted the guest in that room to ask them to stop burning the incense but they obviously did not stop because the odor became stronger. I called a second time and the manager agreed to move us to a room on the other wing. She came and brought keys and we were moved. No hassle or push-back. The manager was very apologetic about the situation. I was glad I asked to be moved because I heard the incense problem affected other guests too and I wasn't sure if all the guests were able to move to other rooms like I did. Anyway, this Hampton Inn was pretty good and the staff were very attentive and friendly. Assuming my son's baseball team goes back to Anthem next year, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: knightrider98
Reviews.Content: We were in need of a hotel room at the last minute, late at night. The appearance of the property was immaculate. The man working the front desk was very nice and inviting. He quickly booked our room and even searched for a pack and play for our infant. The double queen room was spacious with a sleeper couch. The room decor was nice and modern and very clean (cleanest room I've seen in awhile). The bedding was so comfortable. The free hot breakfast in the morning was great with plenty to choose from. Ameel checked us out in the morning and was extremely polite, friendly and seemed thankful for our business with a smile. My only gripe is that the hot water wasn't quite hot enough for us. All and all a wonderful hotel and staff. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Eve at the Hamptons”
Reviews.Author: JUDY G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Christmas Eve as we were attending a family function in the area. We are always totally satisifed with a Hampton Inn. From the time you walked into this cozy lobby, we were greeted with a large bowl of fresh apples. A large crock of hot spiced apple cider was also a nice touch. Breakfast is always satisfying with an array of hot and cold choices. The nice gentleman in charge of the breakfast room just happened to be from my home state, OKlahoma, so enjoyed a nice conversation with him. He was so gracious and I noticed he gave every child a cookied wrapped in a napkin as a special treat. We would recommend this Hampton or any Hampton; price was also very reasonable for the amenities. Sincerely, Judy and Bob Gallaher

Reviews.Title: “Great Hampton Inn Experience”
Reviews.Author: Edger66
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this Hampton for one night due to its proximity to the outlet stores and remote location from the Phoenix traffic. It was a very comfortable hotel with all the great amenities of the Hampton Inn chain. We were not disappointed. Very clean, quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: poco01x
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location during a weekend trip to Cave Creek. Very nice room with a comfy bed, as well as being very clean. We came back from dinner and experienced a very bad sewage type smell. Went down to the front desk and spoke with the desk clerk, James I think, who offered to give us another room, and said there had never been a problem before in this room. Not wanting to move, I declined and asked if they had any air freshener. That seemed to do the trick, and James said he would adjust the bill. I expected perhaps a 10 percent discount, but was very surprised at check out, when there was no charge for the nights stay. This is a great example of customer service and although it was an unfortunate situation, I would not hesitate to stay there again. Good work guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nuristanoply
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two weeks on business. It is very clean and the hotel staff is top notch. Phoenix is not too far away and there are plenty of things to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: 527Irene
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was big and clean as we got used to at all Hampton Inns we stayed at. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: artdeb
Reviews.Content: We had just come in from our trip to Vancouver and were heading to Sedona when a really bad storm came in. After we saw our 5th accident, we decided to get off the road at Anthem and get a room. Lucky us! We found the Hampton Inn. We had a king room with microwave and smal fridge. The bed was very comfortable, the room was very clean and did not have that usual hotel smell. Ameel was at the front desk and was extremely personable and helpful. We had the continental breakfast in the morning which was fresh and also good. The room was a good price too. We are happy to know about this hotel for our future trips down to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nmadr
Reviews.Content: I stay here often. I love their breakfast. The hotel is immaculate, nice pool, and very comfortable rooms. Outlet shopping center just across the street. Short driving distance into Phoenix or even better location if you're going to a sporting event.

Reviews.Title: “Good - just missing the mark in a few areas.”
Reviews.Author: PHXJeremy
Reviews.Content: Great roadside Hampton property. In a corporate park, quiet, and well maintained. My room was clean and bright. The only thing I found odd about the room itself was the shower stall - it doesn't cost much more to do tile or something a little nicer than the fiberglass. It detracted from an otherwise great room. Breakfast looked good - there was a Starbucks too close by for me not to drive through there instead. The biggest gripe I had was the internet situation. Wireless is a standard now - I had to crawl under the desk to unravel an ethernet cord. The "Data port" on the lamp was for a dial-up modem. Very odd.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and arrived after a long flight and were so happy with this place! The rooms were huge and the beds were so big that I felt like a little princess in there. Everything was very clean and the room was conveniently equipped with a microwave and fridge. I slept really good but we definitely needed the AC since it was a warm night outside. The breakfast was also very good, I enjoyed the Cheerios, the Mexican omlette and the sausage. Unfortunately the juice machine was not working but other than that it was great. I also loved the location of it since there was a Denny's and a Mexican place close to it and the next day it only took us 2 mins with the car to get the the Outlet Center. If I ever come to Anthem again, I will for sure stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: seekingcoolerweather
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend with my daughter's softball team. I had called ahead and reserved a group rate with Sarah. I told her that our team was heading up for some scrimmage games in Anthem. When we arrived, we were delightfully surprised to find in our rooms a welcome letter with our team logo and best wishes for a fun time at our scrimmages. There was also a goody bag that the girls really enjoyed. Our team name was posted with best wishes near the front desk. Some of our team has traveled with softball for years and never received this type of welcome at a hotel. It was a very thoughtful gesture that made our girls feel special. Our rooms were huge and clean, beds were comfortable, and the breakfast was perfect. All the staff was very friendly. The girls really enjoyed the pool, too. There was lots of shopping nearby and a Denny's and Del Taco in the same parking lot- very convenient! We really enjoyed our stay and will stay at Hampton Inn Anthem if we ever find ourselves that way again.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't get my rest”
Reviews.Author: lscooljj
Reviews.Content: After a long trip from California, I decided to wash one load of laundry. Over three hours later, I gave up on the dryer; I went to bed at 2:30am. The dryer was blowning cold, and I wasted alot of quarters. When I got to my room, the AC was not working properly. Needless to say, I was very disappointed with this location since I am very loyal to Hampton Inn/Hilton properties.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: rucingok
Reviews.Content: Good hotel that is about 1 hour N of PHX airport. We chose this because we were flying in late, but still wanted to get a jump on the drive to GC the next am. Great breakfast and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Far from Phoenix, but makes up for it in value and service.”
Reviews.Author: ndrwc
Reviews.Content: Only complaint I had for this place was the smoking smell. We were setup with a 3rd floor (top floor) room at the end of the building. We walked by each of the rooms along the way and found no smoking signs next to each door. I think someone broke the rule and the hallway smelled all the way to our end room. The hotel is almost 30 miles away from the PHX airport. Driving there at night was fairly quick, but a bit slower during the day. We chose it because of the combination of good reviews here on TA and cost. We were not disappointed overall. The hot breakfast included was sufficient and the staff member who took care of it was very friendly and did a good job keeping things stocked. We also made sure to choose a hotel that included breakfast. Other than having to wake up sooner than we wanted to make the 10am breakfast end, we were not dissapointed. Great value. Overall service was good. We were warmly greeted when we arrived, greeted the next morning as we went to breakfast, and the room attendents were friendly as we walked by. We didn't have our room cleaned. But, when I needed a bag for clothes, the room attendent was happy to give me one. If you don't mind the distance from the PHX airport, the hotel is in a safe location and I recommend it for service and value. FYI, there's also a Denny's and a 24hr Del Taco right next door. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel”
Reviews.Author: booboomc21
Reviews.Content: Very very nice hotel. I would love to stay there again. unless i had to pay. lol

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lvera
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with friendly helpful staff-you also get adecent enough breakfast. It's a little on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: AZTXAP
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on Oct 2. After arriving by motorcycle I inquired as to the availability of a hot tub and was told it was next to the pool. I changed into my suit and headed for some back relaxation only to find that the spa had been roped off and was down for repairs of some time. Apparently the staff on duty at that time were not aware of it until I told them. It was no big deal and I returned to my room Shortly thereafter someone was knocking on my door and one of the staff had brought me an apology card, a tub of movie popcorn, some candy and water and an invitation to watch a televised movie at no charge. I was very impressed, especially considering that I didn't think it was anything that they needed to go over-and-above for. Five ***** Stars for this hotel and it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place just outside Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: zetep
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay when you do not want to sleep in the city. Good and clean rooms, breakfast,pool, all you need for a pleasant stay when travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, don't think twice”
Reviews.Author: sydshi
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn, Phoenix was a wonderful, simple experience that I highly recommend. Typical tourists, we were doing the Phoenix to Grand Canyon via Sedona thing, and I wanted to get out of the city and "on the way" after a long flight from the East Coast (the wisdom of which was confirmed when my flight was delayed and we came in four hours late). It is a standard Hampton Inn, but the rooms are nice, the people very friendly, the complimentary breakfast well done, and location is conveniently located near Walmart (to stock up on supplies/cooler/water/etc.) and an Outlet mall (vacation purests will criticize our making materialism such a key part of our vacation, but I do have two teenagers . . .)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: PickyAboutHotels43
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our way up to the Grand Canyon. It is a very nice, newer, and well maintained hotel. Breakfast was good as well, with the typical Hampton Inn hot breakfast options. There is a Walmart nearby which was good for stocking up for supplies for hiking in the park.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise And A Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: tony5969
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to be able to obtain a walk-in rate of $63 (via my lady's AARP card) on a Monday night. This property looked brand new and the room was rather spacious and comfortable. The casual dining and retail options nearby were convenient. Their complimentary breakfast selection was possibly the best I ever had at this level of property. I feel we really lucked out on finding this property on the fly. If you have a reason/preference to be this far on the northern outskirts of Phoenix, this is a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Reasonable!!”
Reviews.Author: seachelleRogers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really reasonable and the rooms large. Close enough to the PHX Skyharbor Airport, but yet only about an hour south of Sedona. We were here May 21, 2009, and I would definitely stay here again. The room had 2 queens, sofa, desk, microwave, refrigerator, and coffee pot. We paid around $70-$75. per night, with AAA discount. Did not have an iron or ironing board though. Great selection for free breakfast also. Coffee in lobby 24 hours. Very clean and nice,and I am picky.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bazandbabs24
Reviews.Content: Typical Hampton Inn hotel - clean, big room - does what it should do!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: elisavann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while visiting friends in Anthem, and we were quite pleased. The front desk staff was excellent, very polite and friendly, efficient. The room was clean, attractively decorated, spacious and comfortable. Nice shower, good A/C, very quiet. Mostly the 55 and over golf set stay there, so noise and kids weren't a problem. The pool was clean and inviting, and the jacuzzi was hot and relaxing, although slightly over-chlorinated. Only drawback was the free breakfast. For cold foods, it was great, lots to choose from, and excellent coffee. The daily "hot" special was industrial and disappointing. Kind of like airline food, all pre fab and mass produced, but at least they try. Denny's is across the street for an alternative. Overall a great stay, would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hampton Inn hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Samsara353
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of Hampton Inns and I have to say that this is the absolute best. Actually, one of the better hotel experiences I've had in a very long time. The rooms were spotless! Everything was modern and very clean. The beds were super comfortable as well. This is not a location ideal for those that are basing themselves in Phoenix. Rather it's a good place to stay if you're visiting family in the area or on your way up to Sedona or the Grand Canyon. The hotel is staff is very friendly, the breakfasts are better than average and environment is quite modern and accommodating. Anthem has just about anything that you need - outlet mall across the street, Safeway, Wal-Mart and pretty good local restaurants too. You can even stock up on some wine, cheese, crackers, etc from the gas station next door and have a light dinner outside on the hotel patio by the pool. The hotel even has a little laundry room so you can do your own washing. It's like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Far from City”
Reviews.Author: lani33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Anthem, however, is very far from the city. It is a 30 minute drive into Phoenix and at least a 40 minute drive to Scottsdale - and that is without traffic! If you need to or want to be in the city this is not the best location. If you are going north to Sedona or Grand Canyon it makes sense to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hardtopleasetexan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after arriving late in Phoenix. We were going to Sedona the next day but did not want to drive that far at night. After reading reviews on TA, we decided to give it a try. It is a very nice, clean place to stay. It is across the street from a outlet mall if you are interested. Bottom line, if you are traveling and in doubt, a Hampton Inn is usually a safe bet, but of course, check TA before booking. The accommodations are a little above average and they say the linens are cleaned after every visit. That has been our experience with the two we have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, it is so nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: cupcakesb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way to Sedona. What a pleasant surprise for a "road side" type hotel. The front desk was professional and so nice. Check in a breeze. The room was so clean and modern and very roomy. They launder everything in the room after each customer. The breakfast room was sunny and you could sit outside if you wanted to. I am so picky, so if I tell you it is a nice place to stay, it really is.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value”
Reviews.Author: eclass
Reviews.Content: Little to add to what others have said. Just about a perfect experience. We stayed twice and on each occasion the room and staff were beyond criticism. If you are a Brit flying into Phoenix and traveling on, then this hotel can be reached from the airport in about 40 minutes. Better and cheaper than anything you are likely to find near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the staff”
Reviews.Author: SCBMichigan
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for this property and the wonderful people that work there. Our room was lovely, great bed, very clean bathroom. We booked a one night stay before flying home the next day. My husband became very ill during the night; we ended up having to cancel our plane reservations as he was too ill to travel. Not only did management extend our stay for us, they did it for two more nights as my hubby ended up in the ER. When we came back to the hotel at 3 AM, the staff opened the kitchen and fixed me a bagel when I mentioned I was starving. All this and a NASCAR race pending to boot - they were completely booked up. They bent over backwards for us. Kudos to them all! This is long overdue. I also must praise the guys at Daisy Mountain Fire and Rescue. One of them drove my rental car to the hospital so I could ride in the ambulance with my husband. Then they hung around the hospital talking to me, keeping me company while my husband was examined then they gave me their cell phone numbers in case I needed anything. They even showed up hours later to check on us. What great guys! The Anthem area is blessed to have them looking out for them! Will MOST DEFINITELY stay here the next time we come to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this stopover”
Reviews.Author: nadine2885
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn was a terrific stay for an excellent price. The room was well-appointed and the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds my husband and I have ever experienced. We would definitely recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Night In Arizona”
Reviews.Author: hogie49
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hampton Inn in Anthem! The front desk staff, Ed and Scott were wonderul. I loved the coffee available in the lobby all day and night with cookies too! Our room was super clean and comfortable. The breakfast is adequate but nothing really special. There is the outlet mall within walking distance and restaurants are very close by as well. This was our first night stay in Arizona on our way to the Grand Canyon . Thank you Trip Advisor for helping us find this great place !

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Phoenix/Anthem
HotelInfo.Address: 42415 41st Drive, Phoenix, AZ 85086
